is there a guide on how to dual boot ins: install windows first, make room for linux, and run the installation cd.
no because windows doesn't support any filesystems but it's own. you'll have to install 3rd party software in windows to do that.
what you do in windows is up to you. know that microsoft provides no support at all for anything relating to linux. 3rd party software is required to read your ext3 linux drives.
